definition: reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
tool/device/utensil/equipment/instrument/talent/ability/to possess/to have/to provide/to furnish/to state/classifier for devices, coffins, dead bodies
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: To many people a dictionary is a useful but a bleak compendium.
sentences.chinese: 在許多人看來，詞典是一種有用但乏味的工具書。

sentences.english: Simultaneously we also make up with the inadequate paraphrase of simultaneously Chinese reference book.
sentences.chinese: 同時對現在較權威的語文工具書的訓釋作了一些商兌。

sentences.english: Dictionaries and all books in the reference stacks cannot be checked out.
sentences.chinese: 工具書和參考書書庫中的所有書都不能外借。

sentences.english: But these resources are not being well used. We hope this website will be used as a handbook for S&T researchers.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望，這樣一個網站將成爲科研工作者的工具書。

sentences.english: You have to learn how to use dictionary or reference-books.
sentences.chinese: 你們要搞會使用辭典和工具書。

sentences.english: The quality of reference books should draw the dual attention from both linguistic and legal circles.
sentences.chinese: 語言工具書的質量應當引起語言學和法學的雙重關注。

sentences.english: Students, can you find my name in any reference book?
sentences.chinese: 小朋友，你能利用工具書找出我的名字嗎？

sentences.english: The dictionary also be used as a tool for self-learners of English books.
sentences.chinese: 本詞典也可作爲英語自學者的工具書。

sentences.english: For the missile control entry, which is a good instrument of this book.
sentences.chinese: 對於導彈控制的入門者，這是本很好的工具書。

sentences.english: This Dictionary of the Usage of the English Language is a very good reference book.
sentences.chinese: 這本《英語用法大辭典》是本不錯的工具書。

definition: dictionary/also written 辭典|辞典[ci2 dian3]/CL:部[bu4],本[ben3]
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
Four Books, namely: the Great Learning 大學|大学, the Doctrine of the Mean 中庸, the Analects of Confucius 論語|论语, and Mencius 孟子
dictionary/also written 詞典|词典[ci2 dian3]/CL:本[ben3],部[bu4]
